bookCover.coverDescription: An Interactive book on Life cycle of a butterfly for grade 5 students.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio
Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Butterflies feed on nectar of flowers using a tube-like proboscis. The proboscis is a long and flexible tube. It uncoils to sip food and coils up again into a spiral when not in use.

Butterflies are found all over the world and in all types of environments; hot and cold, dry and moist, at sea level and high in the mountains. However, butterflies are commonly found in tropical regions.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
• Catch a butterfly from your surroundings and observe its body parts carefully.
  • Draw a neat and labelled figure in your practical file and submit it to your science teacher.

metadata.title: Q3- What is the tube-like sucking organ of a butterfly called?

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
1. Egg

1. Egg

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Egg is the first stage of the life cycle of a butterfly. After mating, a female butterfly lays one egg to hundreds of eggs on the lower surface of the leaf. These eggs are attached to the leaf with a sticky secretion secreted by the female along with eggs.

The eggs may be round, spherical, oval, etc. The colour of the eggs may be white, green or yellow depending on the type of butterfly. They lay their eggs on leaves so that the tiny caterpillars start feeding soon after hatching.

2. Larva

2. Larva

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Larva is the second stage in the life cycle of a butterfly. It is also called caterpillar. Each larva hatches from a tiny egg. Soon after hatching most larvae eat the shell of their egg as their first meal. Then they feed on the leaves of the plant on which they are present.

The body of a larva remains covered with numerous hair-like structures called setae. The body of the caterpillar can be divided into three distinct parts. They are head, thorax and abdomen. The head of the larva consists of powerful jaws designed for biting and chewing leaves. The larva of a butterfly is a voracious eater. It feeds on a lot of leaves.

The larva changes its skin 4-5 times as it grows. The process of changing skin by the larva is called moulting. At maturity, the larva stops eating and attaches itself to a leaf, twig, etc. and changes into a pupa. The larval stage lasts from two weeks to one month.

  • Do you know?

The larva or caterpillar of a butterfly feeds on a lot of food. Therefore, it is called a voracious feeder (eater).

params.question: Larva is the first stage of the life cycle of a butterfly.

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
 
Butterflies complete their life cycle in four different stages. They are (i) egg (ii) larva (iii) pupa, and (iv) adult.

params.question: In how many stages does a butterfly complete its life cycle?

metadata.title: Q5- In how many stages does a butterfly complete its life cycle?

params.text:
3. Pupa

3. Pupa

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Pupa is the third stage of the life cycle of a butterfly. It is covered with a hard case called puparium or cocoon.

The pupa neither eats nor moves but active changes take place inside the body. The pupal stage lasts for a few days to several months depending on the climatic condition. The pupa of a butterfly remains suspended from a silk pad and abdominal hooks. The pupa becomes transparent about one day before the adult butterfly emerges.

4. Adult

4. Adult

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: At maturity, a fully developed adult butterfly emerges out from the puparium by tearing it. The newly emerged adult butterfly is called imago.

When the imago emerges, its wings are wrinkled and moist. The imago then rests and dries its wings before flying.

In this way, the life cycle of a butterfly is completed within one month. The cyclic process from the egg to the development of an adult butterfly is called the life cycle of a butterfly.

questions:
1) The third stage in the life cycle of a butterfly is *pupa*.
(egg / adult / pupa / larva)

2) The cover of the pupa is called *puparium*.
(shell / caterpillar / pupal case / puparium)

3) The newly emerged adult butterfly is called *imago*.
(imago / cocoon / caterpillar / larva)

4) The body of a butterfly can be divided into *three||3* parts.
(two / one / three / four)

5) The life cycle of a butterfly completes in *one month*.
(one week / one month / two weeks / two months)

params.textField:
1) Second stage of the life cycle = *Caterpillar*
2) First stage of the life cycle = *Egg*
3) Third stage of the life cycle = *Pupa*
4) Fourth stage of the life cycle = *Adult*
5) Newly emerged adult butterfly = *Imago*
